intro: Struthanthus condensatus, commonly known as the clustered goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Struthanthus condensatus is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
